articles.author: Andrew Jeong, Ben Noll
articles.title: European heat wave closes Eiffel Tower’s top floor and bakes Wimbledon - The Washington Post
articles.description: The heat wave that has blanketed much of Europe is expected to linger over the continent this week, driving up temperatures and offering little reprieve.
articles.content: In Paris, blistering heat led the Eiffel Tower to close its summit and remind prospective visitors to take precautions. In London, the Wimbledon tennis tournament saw its hottest opening day on recor… [+3234 chars]

articles.title: Falcon 9 launches European weather satellite - SpaceNews
articles.description: A Falcon 9 launched a European satellite July 1 with a dual mission to collect weather data and monitor atmospheric pollution.

articles.author: Paolo Confino
articles.title: Dow soars almost 400 points, as investors rotate out of tech and eye Europe - Fortune
articles.description: Investors in the U.S. continued the recent trend of shifting their portfolios to favor European stocks, as the dollar weakens and the euro rises.
articles.content: The Dow Jones rose 396 points, for a 1% gain, on Tuesday, as investors mostly rotated out of the tech sector. That shift favored the 30-company Dow Jones, which is a 1% off its all-time high reached … [+2795 chars]
